meanings.definition: A loud, hollow sound made by an object falling into water.
meanings.sent1: The kerplunks of the rock hitting the water echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: I heard the kerplunks of the coins dropping into the fountain.
meanings.sent3: The ducks giggled at the kerplunks of the acorns dropping into the pond.
meanings.sent4: The kerplunks of the raindrops on the roof sounded like a drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The kerplunks of the pebbles hitting the surface of the lake were like music to my ears.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, hollow sound when falling into water.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally kerplunksed the toy boat into the bathtub.
meanings.sent2: The apples kerplunksed into the bucket as I picked them from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The children laughed as they kerplunksed off the diving board into the pool.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops kerplunksed on the window pane all night long.
meanings.sent5: The stones kerplunksed into the stream, creating ripples in the water.

meanings.definition: The act of falling into water with a loud, hollow sound.
meanings.sent1: The kerplunks of the diver entering the pool were heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: We all laughed at the kerplunks of the clumsy cat falling into the pond.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected kerplunks of the fish jumping out of the water surprised us all.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic kerplunks of the rain hitting the roof put me to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized kerplunks of the synchronized swimmers amazed the audience.
